news.title: Gold reclaims $5,000 as analysts warn volatility is far from over
news.summary: Gold has successfully reclaimed the critical $5,000 psychological floor. Analysts suggest that while the bull market remains intact, short-term volatility driven by macro shifts is expected to persist.

news.title: Crypto Fear Index Hits 'Extreme Fear' (9)
news.summary: Despite Bitcoin hovering near $69k, the Fear & Greed Index has plummeted to 9. This indicates a massive disconnect between BTC price action and retail sentiment, often a precursor to significant market moves.

news.title: Silver inventory plunges as physical demand challenges benchmarks
news.summary: Physical silver demand is outstripping western inventory levels, leading to a plunge in tracked stocks and putting pressure on traditional pricing mechanisms.

macro.insight: New Fed developments and tariff discussions could sap tailwinds for precious metals in Q2, making the current $5k floor a critical test for gold's resilience.

metals.insight: Gold and silver are seeing price gains ahead of US CPI, with technicals suggesting a high-volatility regime is the new normal for 2026.

crypto.insight: Extreme Fear (9) suggests the market is deeply oversold on an emotional basis, though technicals remain fragile as altcoins continue to bleed.

social_intelligence.insight: Sentiment is at its lowest point in years (9/100). Social volume remains high but is dominated by panic and uncertainty.
Community focus has shifted back to gold as a 'flight to safety' asset as crypto volatility returns and support levels are tested.
95%+ probability of Kevin Warsh as next Fed Chair is providing a predictable anchor for macro expectations.
